Reviews.Title: “Good choice if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jstevens
Reviews.Content: Great location, we managed to walk everywhere we wanted to visit from the hotel! Owner was friendly and welcoming. Rome is an expensive city to stay in, and if we had paid the same price in any other place we would have been very disappointed, but this is the capital! We took an ensuite room, but the shower and toilet were similar to a caravans facilities! We had noise from the upstairs neighbours every night, running what sounded like a washing machine through the night?! We were charged 3.5 euros for a very poor breakfast consisting of dried bread, spreads and instant coffee (in Italy!). Best pickup breakfast from the local supermarkets :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget pensione in Rome- clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: packofnails
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay here and were really pleased with this hotel, particularly as we were on a budget and the cost of staying here was comparable with hostels. We were the only people staying in the hotel at the time, in February 2012 and during a particularly cold snap. The shared bathroom was very clean and had a good shower. The room was basic but again clean white sheets and comfortable bed, with space to put our luggage. There is also a sink in the bedroom so that was good for brushing teeth etc. The location was good, 15 minute walk to Termini (more like 20 or so when it was pelting down snow!). There is a supermarket on the way to stock up on food and drinks away from the tourist areas. The couple who ran the hotel were friendly, did not speak much English, and as it was also their home they requested us to not slam the door and things like that- so if you're wanting somewhere big and anonymous and are planning to be loud, this is not the place for you. The lack of breakfast was not an issue as we ate at nearby bakeries, and at the 'pizza al taglio' around the corner- fantastic pizza. the only thing i was unhappy with was that it was a bit too cold- all of our clothes were sopping wet each day due to the snow, and with only one small radiator on very low, it was impossible to dry out clothes before the morning. still, i didnt ask, so maybe they would have been happy to turn it up. would happily stay here again and recommend it highly as a reliable, clean, comfortable budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: WendelvB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 1 km away from Termini station in a quiet street. For what you pay the rooms are of good value, spacious and clean. Our toiletflusher didn't work properly though, but fortunately there was an other toilet in the hallway. The bathroom (en suite) was tiny, so small you could good barely move in the shower, but the water was hot and steady so for us it was fine. All together great value for what you pay (we paid 50 euro a night). There is a little coffee bar at the end of the street where you can get a nice cheap breakfast. A real recommendation is restaurant La Baita, just down the street on Via Luciana. Terrific food for very good prices and good service. The kind of place where al lot of Italians come.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice inexpensive pensione run by a very friendly family that spoke just a little English”
Reviews.Author: traveltheworld012
Reviews.Content: I foud this place online before leaving for Italy from Minnesota. The price was right (E-65/night) and not all that far from the central Roma train station. The front of the building has a 12' high double door (large enough for a car to drive through, which did happen during our stay) that opens onto a courtyard. The hotel is actually on the third floor of the building. We needed 4 keys to enter through 4 doors to get into our room....not a problem. Our room was comfortable with a private bath (rooms with shared baths were a little cheaper but not by much). The night was quiet and peaceful until 7AM when a business in the building started a pounding noise. At 7:30 I heard a car start and looked out the window into the courtyard to see someone drive out through the front double doors. Overall we enjoyed the place, true Italians, very friendly and accomodating. We went into the owner's apartment to pay. A nice first night in Italy experience, close to a few restaurants and a great gelato place right across the street. Not a touristy location, where the locals live and hang out. We liked it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget accommodation in Rome”
Reviews.Author: clarissal
Reviews.Content: Great little place to stay on a budget! As others have said, it's not a hotel but an apartment, but that wasn't a problem for us - we just wanted a place to rest our heads for a couple of nights. The room was a good size, very clean and tidy, and the owner was friendly and welcoming. The bathroom is shared but was never a problem, although it wasn't in amazing condition and the shower is quite small! But that is probably the only "negative" thing I can say about this place, plus because the owner and her family live in a separate living area they are not always immediately on hand like in a hotel. It was very easy to find (with a map anyway, it's down a couple of side roads so I'd recommend printing off a Google directions map unless you get a taxi) and very close to the Termini rail/bus stations and a few attractions. Breakfast cost extra so we chose to go elsewhere for food, and we had to pay an €8 city tax fee when we checked out (which seems to be standard in Rome accommodation) but for the price of the room it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well run and good value ... but a pensione (not a hotel)”
Reviews.Author: ValueValueValue
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Kristi is not a hotel. It is a pensione, and the distinction is important. The pensione occupies part of a multi-storey building. This means that the owner does not control what happens elsewhere in the building. On two of the three nights of my stay, builders were working very noisily elsewhere in the building until 11:30 pm. The pensione is also round the corner from a lively restaurant. From room 6, you can hear the kitchen staff washing dishes until about midnight. The pensione itself is very well run. It is clean, it is very good value for central Rome, and the owner is friendly. Other reviews have mentioned the absence of air-con. Although true, it would be unfair to hold that against the place, because electricity is just plain expensive in Italy. A/C is just not that common at this price (I paid €45/night for a single, shared bath, in late Sep). As with most other inexpensive accommodation, the doors are thin: I expected this. However, perhaps the owner could use a sander on the doors, because, in their current condition, they fit so tightly into their frames that it is impossible to close them without their squeaking. At least the owner has put signs up reminding people not to slam doors! Just to be clear, for me the noise issue was the external noise, not the inevitable noise from the one or two other guests at every hotel who still haven't figured out how to be quiet in shared accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Hme1992
Reviews.Content: We arrived quickly as the location is close to the train station and checked in many hours ahead of schedule but this was fine our room was ready which was very good service. Our room was very basic with no AC! Which meant our room did get very hot! But the bed was clean and so was the bath room. If you can get a good deal I suspect it would be worth it. But with no wifi and no breakfast included in our final price I suspect we could have done better in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cool. Close to Termini.”
Reviews.Author: ssimonka
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic and clean. We reserved two seperate bed, but when we arrived one double bed was prepared. When we expressed our concern thw owner sais she was too tired and that tomorow she would rearrange it. But it was ok. Under our window was a restaurant, but when we closed the windows shut we could not hear the noise. We got clean towels only the second day of our stay. The location was good. Close to Termini and farther from all the noise of the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “clean, simple, good location”
Reviews.Author: cin038
Reviews.Content: it really is a good value for money, there is some noise coming from outside, but that is just the charm from a city and the italian lifestyle. There is no airco, so maybe not the best choice during hot weather, but good for the before and after season. very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid....Not worth your money!”
Reviews.Author: findley2
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here for 4 nights in late August. I arrived and found the hotel fairly easily. As others have written, it is a converted set of apartments. The price was to be 40 euro a night with a bathroom down the hall. First, I don't think it was the safest area. It was near the train station (which, yes, I knew) but it was on a farily quiet street, where I would have felt slightly scared walking at night. Then, the room had no fan, no A/c, nothing but a window over an airless courtyard, where you could hear everything....I mean everything the neighbours were doing. The room was very dirty on the floor, althouh the sheets were clean. The bed was a single metal cot, with a mattress with a lump so big that you could only lie on 1/2 the bed at a time. I actually went down the street and immediately booked another room online for only 15 euro more a night. At 8am, I had to wake the guy up to leave to pay, after not sleeping at all. I would never come back. There are better deals in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Epiphany3
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, Hotel Kristi is a good budget hotel in Rome. Hotel Kristi is basically an apartment where some rooms have been converted into "hotel" rooms, so don't expect to find a front desk, lobby, or large signs for Hotel Kristi on the outside of the building, there's only a small plaque by the door which you can only read if you are standing right outside the door. The hotel is run by a nice family who live on the premises. The father was a pretty nice guy. I stayed in a single bed room with a bathroom. The room and bathroom were small but clean. There is no TV in the room. The shower is a tight fit so if you are a tall or large person you may find it uncomfortable. I got a bit of a scolding from the lady there for making too much noise when it was late, it was a little before midnight. So if you are the type who parties all night or who makes a lot of noise in your room, you might want to look elsewhere. If you are really late checking in like after midnight, make sure to clear it with them before you book. As a place just to sleep and shower, Hotel Kristi is fine. With so many things to do in Rome, why spend much time in your hotel room anyways? It's about a 15 minute walk to the Termini station to the hotel. The closest Metro station is Repubblica and that's about a 10 minute walk. There's a bus stop right around the corner from the hotel on Piave where the 38, 88, 92, and 217 buses all stop. There's also some pasta restaurants and a gelato place a few steps away from the hotel, I didn't try any of them so I can't comment on their quality. Another reviewer mentioned they walked to Trevi Fountains from the hotel, that is quite a long walk, I'd say 30 minutes at least. None of the major tourists attractions are in short walking distance from the hotel. With the Metro and the bus system, you can reach any of them easily though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to start off in rome”
Reviews.Author: Wooggle
Reviews.Content: Out of the 4 'hotels' in italy that we stayed in (with €70 a night between us as a budget) this was definately the best. The room was small but clean and even though we were sharing the bathroom we had a nice big sink which was great and the beds were the most comfortable that we had had in Italy. We arrived at the hotel a little later than check-in closed but as we told the owner this he was very nice and let us in. The location is a good place to start in Rome its only 10 mins from the Termini in a nice neighbourhood and is close to one of the metro stations (I was surprised to find out there were only 2 lines).We managed to walk from the hotel to the Trevi fountain (which really is spectacular) to the Spanish Steps and then on to the Vatican City (its a little bit far- get the metro) I would reccomend this as a cheap alternative- if its luxury you are after then this probably isn't the best place but for €140 for 2 nights for 2 people it was good value- and when you are in Rome you aren't going to be spending that long in the room anyway!

HotelInfo.Name: Kristi
HotelInfo.Address: Via Collina 24, 187 Rome, Italy
